inclusion.criterion: willing to give written informed consent
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: willing to attend necessary follow up visits
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: on effective contraception if sexually active
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: on drugs that might interfere with neuromuscular transmission
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: pain thought to originate from urinary tract
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: symptomatic Urinary Tract Infection with positive urine culture
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: participation in clinical trial involving investigational product in last 3 months
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: previous urethral surgery (other than urethral dilatation)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: pregnant or lactating women and those planning pregnancy
exclusion.label: met

notes: Patient is a 63-year-old man presenting to the Emergency Department with acute urinary retention. He has a large prostate and bladder filled with urine, making him a candidate for urethral catheterization and TURP.
